article_title: Local congressional delegates split on Iran deal
article_text:
Local congressional delegates split on Iran deal

Photo: Edward A. Ornelas / San Antonio Express-News Rep. Lloyd Doggett says he’ll look at Obamacare programs for...

WASHINGTON — The outpouring of criticism directed at the Iran nuclear deal reminds Rep. Lloyd Doggett of the preparations for war in the Middle East.

article_metadata.description: Despite strong objections from Republicans in Congress and GOP presidential hopefuls, it appeared unlikely that opponents could muster the two-third majority needed to override a certain veto from President Barack Obama if the deal is rejected.  Perry, campaigning for the GOP presidential nomination, called the decision to sign the agreement as one of the most destructive foreign policy decisions in my lifetime.  Sen. Ted Cruz of Texas, another Republican presidential hopeful, called the agreement “a staggeringly bad deal” and “a fundamental betrayal of the security of the United States and of our closest allies, first and foremost Israel.”
article_metadata.author.name: By Bill Lambrecht, Washington Bureau
